intro: Heliotropium gracile, commonly known as the slender heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pink or violet flowers that bloom in clusters. Its flowers have a distinctive scent reminiscent of vanilla, which attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies. Heliotropium gracile is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats.
